summary:
I've read about this Soulmate AU where you can hear when your Soulmate's listening to a song and:
IMAGINE CROWLEY AND...
body:
I’ve read about this Soulmate AU where you can hear when your Soulmate’s listening to a song and:

IMAGINE CROWLEY AND AZIRAPHALE

Aziraphale: Oh, no. No, no, no. No! Not again!

Gabriel: What?

Aziraphale: …He’s listening to Queen again…

OR

Crowley: Classic?! Are you shitt- Classic?! Come on, there’s better music out there! Anything but Classic, please!

AND WHAT IF THEY KNOW WHO’S THEIR SOULMATE

CAN YOU IMAGINE CROWLEY RUSHING OVER TO AZIRAPHALE:

Crowley: I’m begging you, stop it! Stop it or I’ll burn your bloody player!

Azirphale: Well, who plays the same songs of the same band over and over again, hm?!

AND THEN IT TURNS INTO A WAR BECAUSE THEY BOTH BELIEVE THAT THEIR MUSIC IS BETTER AND THEY WON’T STOP SO THEY’RE LIKE: MY MUSIC IS BETTER, I CAN PLAY IT LOUDER!

AND ONE DAY CROWLEY COMES BACK TO AZIRAPHALE WITH THE HEADACHE OF HIS LIFE

Crowley: Angel!

Aziraphale: My dear!

Both: …

Both: This has to stop!

Crowley: *breaking down* It’s exhausting, please, we NEED to stop

Aziraphale: *also breaking down* I know, I can’t do this anymore!

blog.name: fuckyeahgoodomens
blog.title: Fuck Yeah Good Omens
blog.description: Funniest apocalypse ever!

summary: ScifiNow Magazine (source) But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on...
caption:
ScifiNow Magazine (source)

But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on Earth. By rights they should hate each other, but having been here since the Garden of Eden, having enjoyed all of humanity’s quirks together, they’ve become accustomed to each other’s company and their adopted home. Hence their panic when word comes up from below that Crowley has been charged with placing the Antichrist - he who will kickstart Armageddon - with the optimum human family. 

“There’s a great sequence at the beginning of episode three,” explains Tennant. "where we jump-cut a few hundred years and we see them at Christ’s crucifixion, at Noah’s Ark, we see them in Shakespeare’s Globe, we see them in the Second World War, and we get glimpses of their life through the millennia, and you see this developing relationship where they’ve started on opposing teams, and yet as the story goes on they inevitably drift towards each other, and indeed inherit this common goal to avert the apocalypse. Really for no other reason than that they’re quite enjoying their life. They don’t want to have to go back to pushing paper. They like dining at the Ritz and this thing known as wine that human beings have invented and fast cars and all that sort of stuff. It’s entirely selfish, but it does mean that their common goal makes them unlikely allies." 

"I remember hearing either Paul or John or someone within The Beatles saying that because no one had ever gone through that before, no one could understand what they were going through,” adds Sheen. “And the only way for them to stay sane was because they were all going through it at the same time, And I sort of feel the same way about Crowley and Aziraphale. No one else knows what it’s like to be on Earth for the whole time since the Garden of Eden. There’s a bond that grows between them because of that, and so consequently they start to become more like each other in a way." 

"He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness,” says Tennant, “and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally.”

But at its heart are Aziraphale and Crowley, the respective representatives of good and evil on Earth. By rights they should hate each other, but having been here since the Garden of Eden, having enjoyed all of humanity’s quirks together, they’ve become accustomed to each other’s company and their adopted home. Hence their panic when word comes up from below that Crowley has been charged with placing the Antichrist - he who will kickstart Armageddon - with the optimum human family. 

“There’s a great sequence at the beginning of episode three,” explains Tennant. "where we jump-cut a few hundred years and we see them at Christ’s crucifixion, at Noah’s Ark, we see them in Shakespeare’s Globe, we see them in the Second World War, and we get glimpses of their life through the millennia, and you see this developing relationship where they’ve started on opposing teams, and yet as the story goes on they inevitably drift towards each other, and indeed inherit this common goal to avert the apocalypse. Really for no other reason than that they’re quite enjoying their life. They don’t want to have to go back to pushing paper. They like dining at the Ritz and this thing known as wine that human beings have invented and fast cars and all that sort of stuff. It’s entirely selfish, but it does mean that their common goal makes them unlikely allies." 

"I remember hearing either Paul or John or someone within The Beatles saying that because no one had ever gone through that before, no one could understand what they were going through,” adds Sheen. “And the only way for them to stay sane was because they were all going through it at the same time, And I sort of feel the same way about Crowley and Aziraphale. No one else knows what it’s like to be on Earth for the whole time since the Garden of Eden. There’s a bond that grows between them because of that, and so consequently they start to become more like each other in a way." 

"He’s an angel who is not without his flashes of naughtiness,” says Tennant, “and I’m a demon who has been known to do the right thing occasionally.”

summary: Crowley so PROTECTIVE of Aziraphale once he's pregnant. Hovering all the time, especially out in public, on high alert.
question: Crowley so PROTECTIVE of Aziraphale once he's pregnant. Hovering all the time, especially out in public, on high alert.
answer:
There is no way he wouldn’t be. Anthony J. “I’m going to run into a burning book shop because I think my husband is trapped somewhere inside, regarding of his celestial status” Crowley likes to think he’s so suave and cool and uncaring. But the fact remains that he is a secret worry wart, and that comes out all the more when Aziraphale is pregnant. He claims it is because Aziraphale is essentially like a human as he carries, but his means of protection go beyond even that. 

Aziraphale only starts to notice when he gets in the Bentley and finds that there are now seat belts. He picks up on more of it. Crowley scolding him for standing on a ladder rack to access some books. Crowley asking him repeatedly if he wouldn’t rather have HIM carry out a “miracle”. Crowley insisting that he essentially stand half-in-front of Aziraphale at all times when they go out. Aziraphale complains, but he really doesn’t mind that much. As sinful as it may be, he finds the gesture to be sweet and he loves to be spoiled.

summary: i'm pretty sure crowley is the snake in your header's image, and you can see his red underbelly in it!
question: i'm pretty sure crowley is the snake in your header's image, and you can see his red underbelly in it!
answer:
:) The thing is I didn’t connect the snake’s skin with Crowley’s clothing before (peeerhaps hair, but clothing? Nope. Didn’t run through my mind :)).

So I was pretty excited about the explanation that the reason for all of those Crowley’s red themes in his clothes is his snakey red underbelly :).

summary: crowley leaves his mobile charged perpetually at 2% just for the residual anxiety everyone else feels whenever a mobile on 2%...
body: crowley leaves his mobile charged perpetually at 2% just for the residual anxiety everyone else feels whenever a mobile on 2% enters a room. “do you want to borrow my charger?” an anxious office temp offers. they’re not even in an office. crowley looks him dead in the eye through his shades and says “no.”

summary: IMAGINE being aziraphale, crowley’s long suffering husband, in the year 2019 and crowley, pacing, smoking aziraphale’s vape bc...
body:
IMAGINE being aziraphale, crowley’s long suffering husband, in the year 2019

and crowley, pacing, smoking aziraphale’s vape bc he was in the mood for a cigarette and then had an honest to god temper tantrum bc his brand went out of brand ages ago and he knew that but he has a craving and so he’s smoking aziraphale’s vape instead although periodically he stops to complain about all aziraphale’s dumb flavours (of which he has tried, today, 12, and enjoyed all of them) and called vapes stupid and goofy (he bought aziraphale the vape) although he likes that all of them are infused with THC

and aziraphale patiently writing out the letter crowley is dictating as he watches him walk back and forth

and it’s just this tweet:

but over 2 pages, and crowley thinks it will be legitimised by aziraphale’s beautiful handwriting but crowley

reblog.comment:
IMAGINE being aziraphale, crowley’s long suffering husband, in the year 2019

and crowley, pacing, smoking aziraphale’s vape bc he was in the mood for a cigarette and then had an honest to god temper tantrum bc his brand went out of brand ages ago and he knew that but he has a craving and so he’s smoking aziraphale’s vape instead although periodically he stops to complain about all aziraphale’s dumb flavours (of which he has tried, today, 12, and enjoyed all of them) and called vapes stupid and goofy (he bought aziraphale the vape) although he likes that all of them are infused with THC

and aziraphale patiently writing out the letter crowley is dictating as he watches him walk back and forth

and it’s just this tweet:

but over 2 pages, and crowley thinks it will be legitimised by aziraphale’s beautiful handwriting but crowley

summary: i can’t stop thinking about how UPSET crowley is about how there’s no good cocaine-based products anymore
title: i can’t stop thinking about how UPSET crowley is about how there’s no good cocaine-based products anymore
body:
so imagine, right, that crowley is prone to colds, bc sometimes life as a demon is hard, and sometimes he gets sick bc of the stress and it’s awful. so we cut to the south downs.

crowley is sick af. 

“aziraphale… please–”

“crowley, we do have a limited supply–”

“i’m SICK”

“yes, dear, i know, but–”

“PLEASE?”

“fine”

so later, you know, crowley is fucking coked up and out of it, but he’s not noticing his cold symptoms at all anymore and is just sprawled out in bed and like

the WONDER of one of the kids like

“um. mr fell?”

“hm?”

“is this the cough syrup you’ve been giving anthony?”

“yes, he’s feeling very under the weather, he–”

“mr fell, this stuff looks like it’s like, 200 years old”

“er, well, no, it–”

“mr fell, it says it’s got cocaine in it. and cannabis too.. and chloroform?”

“well, he’s feeling… much better for it–”

“mr fell, i don’t think he’s feeling anything right now”

the cough syrup stash is Lessening they’re really hoping the good stuff comes into fashion at some point

blog.name: tinsnip
blog.title: No, said Aziraphale, it's ineffable.
blog.description:
Hello, I'm tinsnip.

Feeling rather ineffable these days. Expect a great deal of Good Omens.

Other interests: Star Trek. (Primarily DS9 and Cardassians.)
Pratchett. Wodehouse.
Cats. The Doctors Whom. Science. Cute things. Life truths. Pixels. And spiders, sometimes, so keep that in mind.

I post fic on AO3. It's quite good - you should have a look.

My work with Vyc on a Kardasi conlang is here.

Cardassian meta is found mostly under cardassians or kardasi.

If you enjoy my fanfic, why not buy me a coffee?

summary: “Didn’t you have a flaming sword?” “Er...” “You did, didn’t you? It flamed like anything.” I’ve been meaning to do and Az and...
caption:
“Didn’t you have a flaming sword?”

“Er…”

“You did, didn’t you? It flamed like anything.”

I’ve been meaning to do and Az and Crowley sketch series for just about ever, and since the show is nigh(!) here it goes

Edit: part 2, part 3, part 4, part 5, part 6, part 7

summary: Okay, so was thinking about that necklace post tonight (I can’t find it but you know the one I mean) and I think we missed...
body:
Okay, so was thinking about that necklace post tonight (I can’t find it but you know the one I mean) and I think we missed something…

It’s always been there… hiding in plain sight.


Neilman I swear if we don’t get to see this, I’ll… probably do nothing because I’m not that kind of person.
